abstract_summ: Social distancing is an important and necessary measure to help arrest the spread of SARS-CoV-2 during the COVID-19 pandemic . But it does place persons who are socially or politically marginalized, including those who are of lower socio-economic status, at risk of further harms . This article argues that history has not been kind to Black Americans who have bought into mass national causes, and that there is an opportunity here to act differently .
